Touch Gestures

Touch gestures are often used in devices like tablets and phones to make apps more accessible and intuitive to use. We have integrated Hammer.JS into our Angular core to create easy-to-use directives for gesture-based actions.

Hammer.js Required

Our touch directives use the Hammer.js, library, which makes it easy to hook into common touch actions like swiping, pinching, rotating, and more. Our starter project (installed through the CLI) includes Hammer.js by default.

Swipe Settings

A SwipeSettings provider exists to allow fine tuning of the swipe detection used for a touch directive.

Distance

The minimum swipe distance in px. Named distances can be created to assist with the swipe configuration. The following named distances exist by default: short, normal, far

The default named distances can be cleared by calling SwipeSettingsProvider.clearDistances()

A named distance can be added by calling SwipeSettingsProvider.addDistance(name, value)

Velocity

The minimum swipe speed in px/ms. Named velocities can be created to assist with the swipe configuration. The following named velocities exist by default: slow, normal, fast

The default named velocities can be cleared by calling SwipeSettingsProvider.clearVelocitys()

A named velocity can be added by calling SwipeSettingsProvider.addVelocity(name, value)

Swipe to Close

Add the zf-swipe-close directive to a closable element, such as a panel, off-canvas menu, modal, or notification, to trigger a close when the user swipes over the component. The swipe direction is set on the directive, and can be either up, down, left, or right.

Example Panel

Here's an example of the swipe-to-close directive applied to a panel.

Example Modal

Evaluate on Swipe

Similar to how ng-click allows you to specify custom behavior when an element is clicked, zf-swipe allows you to specify custom behavior when an element is swiped.

Expression

The expression to evaluate when the swipe is triggered. The expression is provided as the value for the zf-swipe attribute.

Element has been swiped {{ swipeCount }} times.

Element has been swiped {{ swipeCount1 }} times.

Direction

The direction the element must be swiped. When not specified, the element can be swiped in any direction.

Element has been swiped LEFT {{ swipeCount }} times.

Element has been swiped {{ swipeCount2 }} times.

Distance

A named distance to use for the swipe detection. When not specified, the default Hammer value is used.

Element has been swiped {{ swipeCount }} times.

Element has been swiped {{ swipeCount3 }} times.

Velocity

A named velocity to use for the swipe detection. When not specified, the default Hammer value is used.

Element has been swiped {{ swipeCount }} times.

Element has been swiped {{ swipeCount4 }} times.
